EA anticheat.notes: Electronic Arts AntiCheat (EAAC) introduced in 2022 (FIFA 23). Uses a kernel driver (eaanticheat.sys) on Windows.
Electronic Arts AntiCheat (EAAC) introduced in 2022 (FIFA 23). Uses a kernel driver (eaanticheat.sys) on Windows.

Hyperion.notes: Byfron 'Hyperion' anti-tamper integrated into Roblox (64-bit client). User-mode anti-cheat (no kernel driver).

Vanguard.notes: Riot Vanguard for Valorant. Always-on kernel driver (vgk.sys) that loads at system startup.

Arbiter.notes: Halo Infinite's proprietary anti-cheat (user-mode only, no kernel driver).

Zakynthos.notes: PUBG's in-house anti-cheat (since 2021). Uses service (zksvc.exe) and kernel driver (Navagio.sys).
PUBG's in-house anti-cheat (since 2021). Uses service (zksvc.exe) and kernel driver (Navagio.sys).

BattlEye.notes: BattlEye anti-cheat with kernel driver (BEDaisy.sys) on Windows. Also supports Linux (Proton) for some games.
BattlEye anti-cheat with kernel driver (BEDaisy.sys) on Windows. Also supports Linux (Proton) for some games.

Uncheater.notes: Used in PUBG Lite and some versions of PUBG. Installs XIGNCODE3’s kernel driver (xhunter1.sys).
Used in PUBG Lite and some versions of PUBG. Installs XIGNCODE3’s kernel driver (xhunter1.sys).
Used in PUBG Lite and some versions of PUBG. Installs XIGNCODE3’s kernel driver (xhunter1.sys).

FairFight.notes: Server-side anti-cheat (statistical analysis). No client driver (runs on game servers).
Server-side anti-cheat (statistical analysis). No client driver (runs on game servers).
Server-side anti-cheat (statistical analysis). No client driver (runs on game servers).
Server-side anti-cheat (statistical analysis). No client driver (runs on game servers).

XIGNCODE3.notes: Wellbia’s anti-cheat often used in Asian games. Employs a kernel-mode driver (xhunter1.sys) on Windows.
Wellbia’s anti-cheat often used in Asian games. Employs a kernel-mode driver (xhunter1.sys) on Windows.
Wellbia’s anti-cheat often used in Asian games. Employs a kernel-mode driver (xhunter1.sys) on Windows.

Wellbia’s anti-cheat often used in Asian games. Employs a kernel-mode driver (xhunter1.sys) on Windows.

VAC.notes: Valve Anti-Cheat. User-mode anti-cheat with delayed ban system (no kernel component). Works across Windows, macOS, Linux.
Valve Anti-Cheat. User-mode anti-cheat with delayed ban system (no kernel component). Works across Windows, macOS, Linux.
Valve Anti-Cheat. User-mode anti-cheat with delayed ban system (no kernel component). Works across Windows, macOS, Linux.
Valve Anti-Cheat. User-mode anti-cheat with delayed ban system (no kernel component). Works across Windows, macOS, Linux.

nProtect GameGuard.notes: GameGuard (INCA Internet). Rootkit-like anti-cheat widely used in MMOs. Loads a kernel module disguised as GameMon.des.
GameGuard (INCA Internet). Rootkit-like anti-cheat widely used in MMOs. Loads a kernel module disguised as GameMon.des.
GameGuard (INCA Internet). Rootkit-like anti-cheat widely used in MMOs. Loads a kernel module disguised as GameMon.des.

NEAC Protect.notes: NetEase’s kernel anti-cheat (NEAC). Used in games like Naraka: Bladepoint. Installs neacsafe.sys driver.

miHoYo Protect.notes: miHoYo’s anti-cheat (Genshin Impact, etc.). Uses kernel driver mhyprot2.sys (notorious for past vulnerabilities).

Denuvo Anti-Cheat.notes: Denuvo Anti-Cheat by Irdeto. Kernel-mode anti-cheat driver installed with games (e.g., Doom Eternal). Runs only while game is active.
Denuvo Anti-Cheat by Irdeto. Kernel-mode anti-cheat driver installed with games (e.g., Doom Eternal). Runs only while game is active.

EQU8.notes: EQU8 anti-cheat (Int3 Software). Uses a kernel driver (EQU8_Helper_xx.sys) to block unauthorized memory access.
EQU8 anti-cheat (Int3 Software). Uses a kernel driver (EQU8_Helper_xx.sys) to block unauthorized memory access.
EQU8 anti-cheat (Int3 Software). Uses a kernel driver (EQU8_Helper_xx.sys) to block unauthorized memory access.

FACEIT.notes: FACEIT Anti-Cheat client for competitive CS:GO, etc. Installs a kernel driver (FACEIT.sys) on Windows.

ESEA.notes: ESEA League anti-cheat client. Uses a kernel driver (historically named dxdiag.sys) on Windows.

Treyarch Anti-Cheat.game: Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War
Treyarch Anti-Cheat.notes: Treyarch’s internal anti-cheat (Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War). Entirely user-mode (no kernel driver).

RICOCHET.notes: Activision’s anti-cheat for Call of Duty. Kernel driver (atvi-brynhildr.sys) runs during gameplay on PC.
Activision’s anti-cheat for Call of Duty. Kernel driver (atvi-brynhildr.sys) runs during gameplay on PC.
Activision’s anti-cheat for Call of Duty. Kernel driver (atvi-brynhildr.sys) runs during gameplay on PC.

RICOCHET.game: Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II (2022)
RICOCHET.notes: Activision’s anti-cheat for Call of Duty. Kernel driver (atvi-brynhildr.sys) runs during gameplay on PC.

PunkBuster.notes: Even Balance’s PunkBuster. Uses PnkBstrA/B services and a kernel driver PnkBstrK.sys on modern systems.
Even Balance’s PunkBuster. Uses PnkBstrA/B services and a kernel driver PnkBstrK.sys on modern systems.
Even Balance’s PunkBuster. Uses PnkBstrA/B services and a kernel driver PnkBstrK.sys on modern systems.

Even Balance’s PunkBuster. Uses PnkBstrA/B services and a kernel driver PnkBstrK.sys on modern systems.

Anti-Cheat Expert.notes: Tencent’s ACE (Anti-Cheat Expert). Kernel-level anti-cheat with drivers (e.g., ace-Base.sys and ace-Game.sys).

Nexon Game Security.notes: Nexon Game Security (NGS). Uses a kernel driver (BlackCat.sys) to protect processes in games like MapleStory.
Nexon Game Security (NGS). Uses a kernel driver (BlackCat.sys) to protect processes in games like MapleStory.
Nexon Game Security (NGS). Uses a kernel driver (BlackCat.sys) to protect processes in games like MapleStory.

Mail.ru Anti-Cheat.notes: Mail.ru/My.Games’ MRAC anti-cheat (used in Warface, etc.). Employs kernel driver mracdrv.sys.
Mail.ru/My.Games’ MRAC anti-cheat (used in Warface, etc.). Employs kernel driver mracdrv.sys.

SARD.notes: SARD Anti-Cheat (AI-powered, introduced ~2024). Kernel-based anti-cheat used in some MMOs (e.g., APB Reloaded).
SARD Anti-Cheat (AI-powered, introduced ~2024). Kernel-based anti-cheat used in some MMOs (e.g., APB Reloaded).

X-Trap.notes: WISELOGIC’s X-Trap anti-cheat (common in older online games). Acts at kernel level to block cheats.
WISELOGIC’s X-Trap anti-cheat (common in older online games). Acts at kernel level to block cheats.

AnyBrain.notes: AnyBrain anti-cheat (focuses on AI-based cheat detection). Likely server-side/behavioral (no kernel driver).

Saberclaw.notes: Saberclaw anti-cheat (little public information). Presumably operates in user-mode.

EMAC LAB.notes: EMAC Lab anti-cheat (details not widely known).

WFSDrv.notes: A kernel driver (WFSDrv.sys) observed in certain games (likely part of an older anti-cheat solution).

Warden.notes: Blizzard’s Warden anti-cheat (used in WoW, etc.). Scans memory from user-mode; no kernel component.
Blizzard’s Warden anti-cheat (used in WoW, etc.). Scans memory from user-mode; no kernel component.

AhnLab HackShield.notes: AhnLab HackShield (legacy anti-cheat). Uses kernel driver (EagleNT.sys) on Windows.

KSophon.notes: Kernel driver (ksophon_x64.sys) known from Tencent’s TenProtect anti-cheat (used in PUBG, etc.).

NetEase Anti-Cheat Expert.notes: NetEase’s own anti-cheat solution (similar to ACE). Uses a kernel driver (neacsafe.sys) on PC.

MY.GAMES Anti-Cheat.notes: My.Games (Mail.ru) anti-cheat, same MRAC system with kernel driver mracdrv.sys.

Proxima Game Anti Cheat.notes: Proxima anti-cheat (e.g., in SYNCED, 2023). Employs kernel-level components (service/driver) to prevent cheating.

Seasun Protect.notes: Seasun Games’ anti-cheat (used in their titles). Likely includes a kernel-mode module.

ESL Wire.notes: ESL Wire anti-cheat client for esports. Primarily user-mode scanning.

NetEase Game Security.notes: NetEase Game Security (general anti-cheat for their games). Details not public; presumably user-mode.

IronShield.notes: Ironshield anti-cheat (Dark and Darker). Runs in user-mode, capturing memory snapshots and screenshots.

Tavern.notes: Dark and Darker’s “Tavern” anti-cheat (Tavern.exe/Worker). No kernel driver; user-mode processes monitor the game.

Esportal.notes: Esportal anti-cheat client (for CS:GO platform). Uses kernel driver EspoDriver.sys on Windows.

GuardenAC.notes: GuardenAC anti-cheat (limited information available). Likely a user-mode anti-cheat solution.

VIOLET.notes: NCSoft’s VIOLET Anti-Cheat (for PURPLE platform games). Operates at user-level to detect unauthorized programs.

Active Anticheat.notes: An anti-cheat referred to as “Active Anticheat”. Presumably no kernel driver (application-level protection).

4game Guard / Frost Security.notes: Frost Security (4game Guard) used by Innova for games like Lineage II. Utilizes low-level (kernel) measures to block cheats.

Arkos.notes: Arkos anti-cheat (very little info publicly). Probably a user-mode anti-cheat system.

TenProtect.notes: Tencent’s TenProtect PC anti-cheat (e.g., for PUBG). Employs kernel driver ksophon_x64.sys.

Fredaikis Anti-Cheat.notes: Anti-cheat used in Fredaikis games (Infestation: The New Z, etc.). Likely runs in user-mode.

CrackProof.notes: “CrackProof” anti-cheat/anti-tamper system noted in some PC titles. Implements kernel-level protections.
“CrackProof” anti-cheat/anti-tamper system noted in some PC titles. Implements kernel-level protections.
“CrackProof” anti-cheat/anti-tamper system noted in some PC titles. Implements kernel-level protections.
“CrackProof” anti-cheat/anti-tamper system noted in some PC titles. Implements kernel-level protections.

SCUE4.notes: SCUE4 anti-cheat (exact identity unclear). Presumably a user-mode anti-cheat component.

Packman.notes: Riot’s Packman (League of Legends anti-tamper). Ring 3 anti-cheat that encrypts and monitors the game client.

GuardingPearSoftware's Anti Cheat Pro.notes: GuardingPearSoftware Anti-Cheat Pro (Unity Asset). Developer-side anti-cheat toolkit (no kernel driver).
